channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Centuries-old 'Frank the Liberty Tree' gets cut down
item.description: People from Florida to Washington want a piece of Frank the Liberty Tree, a huge oak between 250 and 300 years old that was struck by lightning years ago and now must come down.
item.content:encoded: People from Florida to Washington want a piece of Frank the Liberty Tree, a huge oak between 250 and 300 years old that was struck by lightning years ago and now must come down.
item.dc:creator: Frank Morris

item.title: Here to Help: How an LA musician's loss has inspired him to help others
item.description: Brandon Jay and his wife, Gwendolyn Sanford, created Altadena Musicians to help those who may have lost their beloved musical instruments in last year's LA wildfires.
item.content:encoded: Brandon Jay and his wife, Gwendolyn Sanford, created Altadena Musicians to help those who may have lost their beloved musical instruments in last year's LA wildfires.
item.dc:creator: Kira Wakeam

item.title: MLK Day concert held annually at the Kennedy Center for 23 years is relocating
item.description: Georgetown University is moving Let Freedom Ring, its annual event celebrating the life of Martin Luther King Jr., to the historical Howard Theatre in order to save money, the university said.
item.content:encoded:
Georgetown University is moving Let Freedom Ring, its annual event celebrating the life of Martin Luther King Jr., to the historical Howard Theatre in order to save money, the university said.

(Image credit: Lisa Helfert)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Can't decide what to read next? Here are 20 recommendations for your book club
item.description: You know that feeling when you finish a book and just have to discuss it with someone? That's a great book club book. Here are 20 tried-and-true titles that are sure to get the conversation started.
item.content:encoded: You know that feeling when you finish a book and just have to discuss it with someone? That's a great book club book. Here are 20 tried-and-true titles that are sure to get the conversation started.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: The story of 'synergy,' the word we love to hate
item.description: It's not just the quintessential corporate jargon word. "Synergy" goes back hundreds of years, with history in Christianity, medicine and psychology.
item.content:encoded:
It's not just the quintessential corporate jargon word. "Synergy" goes back hundreds of years, with history in Christianity, medicine and psychology.

(Image credit: Nadzeya Dzivakova)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: 'My role was making movies that mattered,' says Jodie Foster, as 'Taxi Driver' turns 50
item.description: Foster was just 12 years old when she starred in the 1976 film. "What luck to have been part of that, our golden age of cinema in the '70s," she says. Her latest film is Vie Privée (A Private Life).
item.content:encoded:
Foster was just 12 years old when she starred in the 1976 film. "What luck to have been part of that, our golden age of cinema in the '70s," she says. Her latest film is Vie Privée (A Private Life).

(Image credit: Gareth Cattermole)
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Keep an eye out for these new books from big names in January
item.description: The new year begins with a host of promising titles from George Saunders, Julian Barnes, Jennette McCurdy, Karl Ove Knausgaard and more. Here's a look ahead at what's publishing this month.
item.content:encoded: The new year begins with a host of promising titles from George Saunders, Julian Barnes, Jennette McCurdy, Karl Ove Knausgaard and more. Here's a look ahead at what's publishing this month.
item.dc:creator: Colin Dwyer

item.title: Scott Adams, the controversial cartoonist behind 'Dilbert,' dies at 68
item.description: Adams announced in May that he was dying of metastatic prostate cancer. Thousands of newspapers carried his strip satirizing office culture starting the '90s, until a controversy in 2023.
item.content:encoded:
Adams announced in May that he was dying of metastatic prostate cancer. Thousands of newspapers carried his strip satirizing office culture starting the '90s, until a controversy in 2023.

(Image credit: Lea Suzuki)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 'Fly, Wild Swans' is Jung Chang's painfully personal tribute to her mother
item.description: A historian of modern China, Jung Chang turns the lens back on herself in her newest book to understand how she sees the world and why she writes about China today.
item.content:encoded: A historian of modern China, Jung Chang turns the lens back on herself in her newest book to understand how she sees the world and why she writes about China today.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Today is the Smithsonian's deadline to give thousands of documents to the White House
item.description: The White House says the Smithsonian Institution must submit materials about current and upcoming exhibitions and events for a review that will determine whether they express "improper ideology."
item.content:encoded:
The White House says the Smithsonian Institution must submit materials about current and upcoming exhibitions and events for a review that will determine whether they express "improper ideology."

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas
